intro: Hypericum caracasanum subsp. caracasanum, commonly known as the Carpathian St. John's wort, is a perennial shrub native to the Carpathian Mountains. It features erect, branching stems covered in yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has opposite, oval-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or forested areas. Its medicinal properties have been historically used in traditional herbal remedies.
